# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = "$word "
        else
            line *= "$word "
        end
    end
    result *= "\n" * line
    return result
end
```

Here is an example:

```julia
println(wrap_string("This is a test string that will be wrapped", 10))
```

The output of this code would be:

```
This is a
test string
that will be
wrapped
```
